intro: Gonostemon praetermissus var. luteolus, commonly known as the yellow-flowered gonostemon, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
